text: for our next exercise you need to know a
few expressions so let me explain them
the first one is lovesick if you're
lovesick then you feel sad because the
person you love is not with you maybe
they're far away maybe they've left you
probably for another person that's why
you're lovesick second expression is
lightheaded if you're lightheaded it's a
feeling of being dizzy unsteady on your
feet
probably because you're sick or maybe
you've drunk too much or perhaps you
haven't eaten a lot so if you're
lightheaded you feel a little dizzy you
often feel light-headed if you stand up
too quickly do you know that feeling
that's lightheaded the next expression
is lost-and-found
lost-and-found is a place a department
it's where things that are found are
taken with the hopes that the owners
will come and collect them so if you
lost something at the airport or a train
station or a nightclub you can go to the
lost and found you can ask someone
excuse me where's the lost and found
another expression is live-and-let-live
we say this to mean that you can live
your life peacefully and let others live
their life peacefully you live the way
you want and let others live the way
they want and then there are no problems
live-and-let-live low end low end is a
way to describe things that are
inexpensive the opposite is high end so
if you're talking about technology or
cars or appliances they can be high end
or low end low end is not very expensive
the final expression is a lucky charm
this is an object that you believe
brings luck to you for Americans a lucky
charm is often a rabbit's foot for some
reason
exercise 4 choose the correct expression
to complete the statement you read the
statement to yourself and then I'll tell
you the answer
answer a ever since Logan went off to
college Lee has been lovesick too
answer be lanced doesn't like to get
involved in other people's problems he
says live and let live
three

so she had to buy a low-end laptop
computer for
answer be Lukas felt lightheaded because

before 5:00
answer a Lindsay went to the airlines
lost and found with the hope of finding

answer be Liam always carries an old
penny in his pocket Liam says it's his
lucky charm now of course I talked about
confusing L and T and D but the biggest
confusion often comes between l and r
and here's the difference let's talk
about the difference with words like lap
and rap rap you know is the kind of
music and lap is your upper front legs
when you sit down you can put a small
child on your lap or a cat can sit on
your lap lap is made like laughs the tip
of your tongue is against that bump and
then it drops down to make the vowel
ah okay but with rap your tongue never
touches the bump it never touches any
part of the roof of your mouth it comes
close but it doesn't touch that's the
biggest difference the rest of your
tongue is pulled back it's like in a
small tight ball the tongue is more
tense for rap for are than it is for lap
l got it again the position of your
tongue is a little different the tip of
your tongue for L and Lap touch of that
bump and the sides are down with R and
wrap the tip of your tongue goes up
towards that bump but it doesn't touch
the rest of your tongue is sort of
bunched up and tight and raised towards
the roof of your mouth
rap rap another difference is the
position of your lips watch for a moment
lap lap rap rap
with L I told you not to pull your lips
out and not to make a tight little
circle something in between relax a
little and have a gentle rounding lap
lap but with are your lips are more
rounded in a little more tense lap lap
rap rap to see the difference exercise
